30T13:46:35.804-08:00;;;;;;;;改进云的模拟及其对气候的影响</stitle>;<content type="html">;<span class="byline-author">;由 Tapio Schneider 发布，客座研究员和 Google 研究部工程负责人陈一凡</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEipIpAUM7d1E-XNQdqZ3hiRC7VgksSfuI249KFq9yL5ZTZF8-DJ5Sfo-fRf2m7hTKuTeJwSGQzwz6 rtfdZs8PxlualXz7U53miz6ahU3oyO9WQWkePA1fgr5mxRa75NYKKPe0KLOYSPLxzfDfoIABePqL1etrqaDuRPjJotAVEIbuBRw6EWrJSxXB-BzCTS/s320 /hero.gif" style="显示：无；" />; <p>; 当今的气候模型成功地捕捉了广泛的全球变暖趋势。然而，由于<a href="https://physicalstoday.sitation.org/doi/abs/10.1063/PT.3.4772">;规模小但具有全球重要性</a>;的过程存在不确定性，例如<a href="http://rdcu.be/ohot">;云</a>;和<a href="https://doi.org/10.3389/fmars.2019.00065">;海洋湍流</a>;，这些模型对即将到来的气候变化的预测在细节上不是很准确。例如，预测地球全球平均表面温度相对于工业化前时期将变暖2℃的时间，<a href="https://www.ipcc.ch/report/ar6/wg1/downloads/ report/IPCC_AR6_WGI_TS.pdf">;当今的模型相差 40-50 年</a>;（整整一代人）。因此，我们没有规划弹性基础设施所需的<a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41558-020-00984-6">;准确且精细的地理预测</a>; ，调整供应链以适应气候破坏，并评估脆弱社区面临的气候相关危害的风险。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; 这在很大程度上是因为云在未来几十年的气候预测中主导着错误和不确定性 [<a href="https://doi.org /10.1029/2005GL023851">;1</a>;，<a href="https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00382-013-1725-9">;2</a>;，<a href= “https://doi.org/10.1038/nclimate3402">;3</a>;]。云反射阳光并产生<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greenhouse_effect">;温室效应</a>;，这使得它们对于调节地球的能量平衡和调节气候系统对气候的响应至关重要。温室气体浓度的变化。然而，它们的规模太小，无法在当今的气候模型中直接解析。目前的气候模型可以解决数十到一百公里尺度的运动，<a href="https://link.springer.com/article/10.1186/s40645-019-0304-z">;很少有推动</a >; <a href="https://journals.ametsoc.org/view/journals/bams/101/5/bams-d-18-0167.1.xml">;千米规模</a>;。然而，维持覆盖大片热带海洋的低云等的湍流空气运动的尺度为数米至数十米。由于规模差异巨大，气候模型使用云的经验参数化，而不是直接模拟它们，这会导致较大的误差和不确定性。 </p>; <p>; 虽然云无法在全球气候模型中直接解析，但可以通过使用高分辨率<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Large_eddy_simulation 在有限区域内模拟云的湍流动力学">;大涡流模拟</a>; (LES)。然而，使用 LES 模拟云的高计算成本阻碍了广泛和系统的数值实验，并且阻碍了用于训练参数化方案以在较粗分辨率的全球气候模型中表示云的大型数据集的生成。 </p>; <p>; 在“<a href="https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1029/2023MS003619">;使用张量处理单元加速云的大涡模拟</a>; ”，发表于 <em>;<a href="https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/journal/19422466">;地球系统建模进展杂志</a>;</em>; (JAMES) 和我们与 Google 客座研究员<a href="https://clima.caltech.edu/">;气候模拟联盟</a>; (CliMA) 负责人合作，证明<a href="https:/ /cloud.google.com/tpu">;张量处理单元</a>; (TPU) — 最初为机器学习 (ML) 应用开发的专用集成电路 — 可有效用于执行云的 LES。我们证明，TPU 与定制的软件实现相结合，可用于在特定条件下模拟计算上特别具有挑战性的<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marine_stratocumulus">;海洋层积云</a>;在<a href="https://doi.org/10.1175/MWR2930.1">;海洋层积云动力学和化学</a>; (DYCOMS) 实地研究期间观察到的结果。这个基于 TPU 的成功 LES 代码揭示了 TPU 的实用性，以及其庞大的计算资源和紧密的互连，用于云模拟。 </p>; <p>; 过去 20 年来，气候模型对降水量或大气层顶部能量平衡等关键指标的准确性每十年提高了约 10%。我们这项研究的目标是通过改善云的表现，将气候模型的误差减少 50%。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;TPU 上的大涡模拟</h2>; <p>; 在这项工作中，我们重点关注层积云云，覆盖约 20% 的热带海洋，是地球上最普遍的云类型。当前的气候模型尚无法正确再现层积云的行为，这一直是这些模型中最大的错误来源之一。我们的工作将为大规模气候模型提供更准确的地面事实。 </p>; <p>; 我们在 TPU 上对云的模拟表现出前所未有的计算吞吐量和扩展能力，例如，可以在最大约 35 × 54 km 的区域内模拟层积云，其实时演化速度提高 10 倍< sup>;2</sup>;。这样的域大小接近典型全球气候模型网格盒的横截面积。我们的结果为计算实验开辟了新途径，并大大扩大了可用于训练全球气候模型云参数化的 LES 样本。</p>; <tablealign="center" cellpadding="8" cellspacing="4" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: DYCOMS 现场活动期间的条件。基于 TPU 的代码可靠地再现了飞机在野外活动中观察到的云场和湍流特征，这一壮举<a href="https://doi.org/10.1175/MWR2930.1">;对于LES</a>;是因为层积云顶部的<a href="https://doi.org/10.1029/2018MS001312">;温度和其他热力学特性的快速变化</a>;。 </p>; href="https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1029/2023MS003619">;论文</a>;中描述的额外物理过程；例如，需要将辐射传输过程集成到代码中。我们的目标是生成各种云类型的数据，例如雷暴云。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="byline-author">;发布者：Dave Hawkey，软件Google 研究工程师</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgrfdKR8ZnuQ1jMtsIsG9AViwd_vkXhbwavfXUC_RYoIeTF8EppGOxlWSp9DNCgzFlUY0Ea4q3deujDXSdXJ_C4lOC89e href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2021/05/project-guideline-enabling-those-with.html">;发布了项目指南</a>;， Google Research 与<a href="https://www.guidingeyes.org/">;Guiding Eyes for the Blind</a>; 合作，帮助视力障碍（例如失明和弱视）人士步行、慢跑，并独立运行。 Project Guideline 仅使用 Google Pixel 手机和耳机，利用设备上的机器学习 (ML) 引导用户沿着标有画线的户外路径行驶。该技术已经<a href="https://projectguidelinejp.withgoogle.com/intl/en/">;在世界各地进行了测试</a>;，甚至在<a href="https://www. youtube.com/live/2cW1-plwqeQ?si=MTIX2uJkyWuLluht&t=7334">;2020 年东京残奥会开幕式</a>;。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; 自最初发布以来，我们开始通过嵌入障碍物检测和高级路径规划等新功能来改进项目指南，以安全可靠地导航用户通过更复杂的场景（例如急转弯和附近的行人）。早期版本具有简单的逐帧图像分割功能，可检测路径线相对于图像帧的位置。这足以将用户定向到线路，但提供了有关周围环境的有限信息。改善导航信号，例如障碍物和即将转弯的警报，需要更好地理解和绘制用户环境。为了解决这些挑战，我们构建了一个平台，可用于无障碍空间及其他领域的各种空间感知应用程序。 </p>; <p>; 今天，我们宣布<a href="https://github.com/google-research/project-guideline">;开源版本的项目指南</a>;，供任何人使用用于改进和构建新的无障碍体验。该版本包括核心平台的<a href="https://github.com/google-research/project-guideline">;源代码</a>;，以及<a href="https://github.com/ google-research/project-guideline/tree/main/project_guideline/android">;Android 应用</a>;，经过预训练<a href="https://github.com/google-research/project-guideline/tree/ main/project_guideline/vision/models">;ML 模型</a>;，以及 <a href="https://github.com/google-research/project-guideline/tree/main/project_guideline/unreal">;3D 模拟框架</a>;。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;系统设计</h2>; <p>; 主要用例是 Android 应用程序，但是我们希望能够以可重现的方式在各种环境中运行、测试和调试核心逻辑。这促使我们使用 C++ 设计和构建系统，以便与 <a href="https://developers.google.com/mediapipe">;MediaPipe</a>; 和其他核心库紧密集成，同时仍然能够与Android 使用 <a href="https://hcil.umd.edu/human-centered-ai/">;人为centered ai的扩展，也是人为</a>;专注于社会总体需求的人类</a>;仍然受到个人用户的需求，特别是在更大，共享的人类经验的背景下。最近的AI进步提供了前所未有的社会水平能力，现在我们可以有条不紊地满足这些需求 - 如果我们将集体的，多学科的AI研究应用于社会级别，共同的挑战，从预测饥饿到预测疾病到提高生产力。 </p>; <p>; <a href="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-publish-prod/documents/ai_opportunity_agenda.pdf">; ai </a>;有利于社会的机会增加天。我们在这些领域以及我们支持的研究项目中审视了我们的工作。最近，Google <a href="https://research.google/outreach/outreach/air-program/recipients/">;宣布，选择了70个教授</a>; </a>; <a href =“ https://research.google /宣传/空中策略/“>; 2023包容性研究计划奖” </a>;，该计划支持在全球历史上边缘化群体的需求方面的学术研究。通过评估这项工作，我们确定了以社会为中心的AI的一些新兴实践：</p>; <ul>; <li>; <strong>;了解社会的需求</strong>; <br/>;听取社区和伙伴的要求对深入了解主要问题，并确定要解决的优先挑战。作为一种新兴的通用技术，人工智能有可能解决可能影响人们生活的重大全球社会问题（例如，教育工人，改善医疗保健并提高生产率）。我们发现影响的关键是要以社会的需求为中心。为此，我们将努力集中在社会已经同意的目标上，例如联合国'<a href="https://globalgoals.withgoogle.com/globalgoals/globalgoals/globalgoals">; 17 17可持续发展的发展目标</a>; ，由190多个国家共同制定的一系列相互联系的目标，以应对全球挑战。 </li>; <li>; <strong>;集体努力以满足这些需求<br />; </>;开发和部署AI技术以满足社会需求时，对AI技术的开发，实施和评估。 </li>; <li>; <strong>;通过努力满足社会需求的如何衡量成功<br />; </strong>;衡量AI解决方案如何满足社会需求是很重要的。在每种情况下，我们确定了通过与利益相关者的合作进行了优化的主要和次要影响指标。 </li>; </ul>; <div style =“ Genai虽然非常有益，但也带来了虚假信息，偏见和安全的风险。在2018年，Google开创了<a href="https://ai.google/responsibility/principles/">; AI原则</a>;，强调有益的使用和预防伤害。从那时起，Google一直专注于有效地在<a href="https://ai.google/responsibility/responsible-ai-practices/">;负责的AI实践</a>;通过1）全面风险评估框架中有效地实施我们的原则。 ，2）内部治理结构，3）教育，使Google授权将AI原则整合到其工作中，以及4）开发过程和工具的开发，这些过程和工具可以识别，测量和分析在AI驱动产品的整个生命周期中的道德风险。辫子团队专注于最后一个领域，创建工具和技术，以识别Genai产品中的道德和安全风险，使Google内部的团队能够应用适当的缓解。 </p>; <div style =“ line-height：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </>; </>;伴随着新的潜在故障范围，强调了一种全面有系统的RAI方法的紧迫性，以理解和减轻潜在的安全问题，然后才能广泛使用该模型。一种用于了解潜在风险的关键技术是<em>;对抗性测试</em>;，它正在系统地评估模型的测试，以了解在各种情况下提供恶意或无意中有害输入时其行为的行为。为此，我们的研究集中在三个方向上：</p>; <li>; <em>;缩放对抗性数据生成</em>; <br />;给定不同的用户社区，用例和行为，在推出产品或服务之前，很难全面识别关键的安全问题。通过创建包含各种各样且潜在的不安全模型输入的测试集，与人类中的人类数据生成有关的对抗性数据生成可以解决这一需求，这些模型输入在不利情况下强调模型能力。我们在辫子上的独特重点在于确定对受模型影响的各种用户社区的社会危害。 </li>; <li>; <em>;自动测试集评估和社区参与</em>; <br />;缩放测试过程，以便可以快速评估成千上万的模型响应，以了解模型如何跨范围内响应自动测试集评估有助于潜在有害的情况。除了通过对抗性测试集进行测试之外，社区参与是我们识别“未知未知数”并播种数据生成过程的关键组成部分。</li>; <li>; <li>; <em>;评估者多样性</em>; <br />;安全评估依赖于人类判断，这是由社区和文化塑造的，并且不容易自动化。为了解决这个问题，我们优先考虑有关评估者多样性的研究。</li>; </ol>; <div style =“ line-height：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </>; </div>; <h2>;缩放的对抗性数据生成</ H2>; <p>;高质量的全面数据基于Google的许多关键程序。最初依赖手动数据生成，我们已经取得了长足的进步来自动化对抗数据生成过程。可以使用带有用例和政策一致提示的集中式数据存储库来启动新的对抗测试。我们还基于大型语言模型（LLM）开发了多个合成数据生成工具，该工具优先考虑反映不同社会环境的数据集，并将数据质量指标整合起来，以改善数据集质量和多样性。 </p>; <li>;测量与Google对齐的测量/使用Policy“>;生成的AI策略</a>;和预期的用例。</li>; <li>;对抗性分析以确保我们同时检查两个明确的（明确设计的输入旨在产生不安全的输出）和隐式（输入是无害的，但输出是有害的）查询。 </li>; </ul>; <p>;我们在<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.08592">; href="https://blog.research.google/2023/10/supporting-benchmarks-for-ai-safety.html">;公共基准AI安全</一个>;。 </p>; <div style =“线路高：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </>; </div>; <h2>;对抗性测试和社区洞察力</h2>; <p>;用对抗性测试集评估模型输出，在部署之前确定关键的安全问题。我们的初步评估仅依赖于人类评级，这导致了由于缺乏标准化的安全定义和政策而导致的转变时间缓慢和不一致。我们通过引入政策一致的评估者指南来提高评估者的准确性，并研究了更多改进，以更好地反映不同社区的观点，从而提高了评估的质量。此外，使用基于LLM的自动转速器进行自动测试集评估可以提高效率和缩放，同时使我们能够将复杂或模棱两可的案例指向人类以获得专家评级。 href="https://dynabench.org/tasks/adversarial-nibbler">;对抗性nibbler Challenge </a>;让外部用户了解<a href =的潜在危害/2305.14384">; nunsafe，有偏见或暴力输出</a>;最终用户的大规模用户。 Our continuous commitment to community engagement includes gathering feedback from diverse communities and collaborating with the research community, for example during <a href="https://sites.google.com/view/art-of-safety">;The ART of Safety workshop</a>; at the <a href="http://www.ijcnlp-aacl2023.org/">;Asia-Pacific Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics Conference</a>; (IJCNLP-AACL 2023) to address adversarial testing challenges for GenAI. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Rater diversity in safety evaluation</h2>; <p>; Understanding and mitigating GenAI safety risks is both a technical and social challenge. Safety perceptions are intrinsically subjective and influenced by a wide range of intersecting factors. Our in-depth study on demographic influences on safety perceptions explored the <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.11530">;intersectional effects of rater demographics</a>; (eg, race/ethnicity, gender, age) and content characteristics (eg, degree of harm) on safety assessments of GenAI outputs. Traditional approaches largely ignore inherent subjectivity and the systematic disagreements among raters, which can mask important cultural differences. Our <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.05074">;disagreement analysis framework</a>; surfaced a variety of disagreement patterns between raters from diverse backgrounds including also with “ground truth” expert ratings. This paves the way to new approaches for assessing quality of human annotation and model evaluations beyond the simplistic use of gold labels. Our <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.11247">;NeurIPS 2023 publication</a>; introduces the <a href="https://github.com/google-research-datasets/dices-dataset">;DICES</a>; (Diversity In Conversational AI Evaluation for Safety) dataset that facilitates nuanced safety evaluation of LLMs and accounts for variance, ambiguity, and diversity in various cultural contexts. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Summary</h2>; <p>; GenAI has resulted in a technology transformation, opening possibilities for rapid development and customization even without coding. However, it also comes with a risk of generating harmful outputs. Our proactive adversarial testing program identifies and mitigates GenAI risks to ensure inclusive model behavior. Adversarial testing and red teaming are essential components of a Safety strategy, and conducting them in a comprehensive manner is essential. The rapid pace of innovation demands that we constantly challenge ourselves to find “unknown unknowns” in cooperation with our internal partners, diverse user communities, and other industry experts. Google DeepMind </span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhS9q_iPaPNyYexT4zpSTnERwHJJGcmOemvRjjqD9sNPMwibC-iV5AU2P4J9VrPE_NGFyFz5QLxHpCti9Y-bOPEi9XPCev5YwIpNKPMECDxk1prmksf99tPHgf1uQb7EW3zSmnIMWIFwAjvM7GldhsEtW7eogo1sG1L1nxD8UPIi0fpHR_Iwp8fJTdoUnQB/s1600/mirasol.png" style="display: none;" />; <p>; When building machine learning models for real-life applications, we need to consider inputs from multiple modalities in order to capture various aspects of the world around us. For example, audio, video, and text all provide varied and complementary information about a visual input. However, building multimodal models is challenging due to the heterogeneity of the modalities. Some of the modalities might be well synchronized in time (eg, audio, video) but not aligned with text. Furthermore, the large volume of data in video and audio signals is much larger than that in text, so when combining them in multimodal models, video and audio often cannot be fully consumed and need to be disproportionately compressed. This problem is exacerbated for longer video inputs. </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; In “<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.05698">;Mirasol3B: A Multimodal Autoregressive model for time-aligned and contextual modalities</a>;”, we introduce a multimodal <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autoregressive_model">;autoregressive</a>; model (Mirasol3B) for learning across audio, video, and text方式。 The main idea is to decouple the multimodal modeling into separate focused autoregressive models, processing the inputs according to the characteristics of the modalities. Our model consists of an autoregressive component for the time-synchronized modalities (audio and video) and a separate autoregressive component for modalities that are not necessarily time-aligned but are still sequential, eg, text inputs, such as a title or description. Additionally, the time-aligned modalities are partitioned in time where local features can be jointly learned. In this way, audio-video inputs are modeled in time and are allocated comparatively more parameters than prior works. With this approach, we can effortlessly handle much longer videos (eg, 128-512 frames) compared to other multimodal models. At 3B parameters, Mirasol3B is compact compared to prior <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2204.14198">;Flamingo</a>; (80B) and <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2305.18565">;PaLI-X</a>; (55B) models. Finally, Mirasol3B outperforms the state-of-the-art approaches on <a href="https://blog.research.google/2022/08/efficient-video-text-learning-with.html">;video question answering</a>; (video QA), long video QA, and audio-video-text benchmarks. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgshWPBWMbvzrYbGl-41QRmA5NWiQ4GKMb_nlTl-uKlY6D9TEKosZWbJk_wnllLqyq4GUQT6feI_rLH4rrYVoZHHQET750qT1pxkkiju6mWqG7ddCxLjgpywTb3rnQdDtaUTOeRvnZD0_a2mMauvs7vu6pzboeWcTCt_7bloNMDdZfNyM3Y_7UKcN-7VSqS/s1240/image5.gif" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="960" data-original-width="1240" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgshWPBWMbvzrYbGl-41QRmA5NWiQ4GKMb_nlTl-uKlY6D9TEKosZWbJk_wnllLqyq4GUQT6feI_rLH4rrYVoZHHQET750qT1pxkkiju6mWqG7ddCxLjgpywTb3rnQdDtaUTOeRvnZD0_a2mMauvs7vu6pzboeWcTCt_7bloNMDdZfNyM3Y_7UKcN-7VSqS/s16000/image5.gif" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;The Mirasol3B architecture consists of an autoregressive model for the time-aligned modalities (audio and video), which are partitioned in chunks, and a separate autoregressive model for the unaligned context modalities (eg, text). Joint feature learning is conducted by the Combiner, which learns compact but sufficiently informative features, allowing the processing of long video/audio inputs.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Coordinating time-aligned and contextual modalities</h2>; <p>; Video, audio and text are diverse modalities with distinct characteristics. For example, video is a spatio-temporal visual signal with 30–100 frames per second, but due to the large volume of data, typically only 32–64 frames <em>;per video</em>; are consumed by current models. Audio is a one-dimensional temporal signal obtained at much higher frequency than video (eg, at 16 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hertz">;Hz</a>;), whereas text inputs that apply to the whole video, are typically 200–300 word-sequence and serve as a context to the audio-video inputs. To that end, we propose a model consisting of an autoregressive component that fuses and jointly learns the time-aligned signals, which occur at high frequencies and are roughly synchronized, and another autoregressive component for processing non-aligned signals. Learning between the components for the time-aligned and contextual modalities is coordinated via cross-attention mechanisms that allow the two to exchange information while learning in a sequence without having to synchronize them in time. </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Time-aligned autoregressive modeling of video and audio</h2>; <p>; Long videos can convey rich information and activities happening in a sequence. However, present models approach video modeling by extracting all the information at once, without sufficient temporal information. To address this, we apply an autoregressive modeling strategy where we condition jointly learned video and audio representations for one time interval on feature representations from previous time intervals. This preserves temporal information. </p>; <p>; The video is first partitioned into smaller video chunks. Each chunk itself can be 4–64 frames. The features corresponding to each chunk are then processed by a learning module, called the Combiner (described below), which generates a joint audio and video feature representation at the current step — this step extracts and compacts the most important information per chunk. Next, we process this joint feature representation with an autoregressive Transformer, which applies attention to the previous feature representation and generates the joint feature representation for the next step. Consequently, the model learns how to represent not only each individual chunk, but also how the chunks relate temporally. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh90Ao2yyoC5TSypNxQzA7F80lQla0f4STDrB6ZdVhINwiiQjOq1WppROFurlUn9-Lq_UUQ9uuQIeRDld-j2NMYl1e5q2Cg2L0zOHXSG0dAkpCSqVe-wEyE8QZtUup7AUazE3sBEyoO2T3RhWSc5Z7o1w0pyqMH0WzTts3vaxUnMNOa61uWXvQ2Wj92evO5/s1259/image1.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="744" data-original-width="1259" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh90Ao2yyoC5TSypNxQzA7F80lQla0f4STDrB6ZdVhINwiiQjOq1WppROFurlUn9-Lq_UUQ9uuQIeRDld-j2NMYl1e5q2Cg2L0zOHXSG0dAkpCSqVe-wEyE8QZtUup7AUazE3sBEyoO2T3RhWSc5Z7o1w0pyqMH0WzTts3vaxUnMNOa61uWXvQ2Wj92evO5/s16000/image1.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;We use an autoregressive modeling of the audio and video inputs, partitioning them in time and learning joint feature representations, which are then autoregressively learned in sequence.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Modeling long videos with a modality combiner</h2>; <p>; To combine the signals from the video and audio information in each video chunk, we propose a learning module called the Combiner. Video and audio signals are aligned by taking the audio inputs that correspond to a specific video timeframe. We then process video and audio inputs spatio-temporally, extracting information particularly relevant to <em>;changes in the inputs</em>; (for videos we use <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.03229">;sparse video tubes</a>;, and for audio we apply the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spectrogram">;spectrogram</a>; representation, both of which are processed by a <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2010.11929">;Vision Transformer)</a>;. We concatenate and input these features to the Combiner, which is designed to learn a new feature representation capturing both these inputs. To address the challenge of the large volume of data in video and audio signals, another goal of the Combiner is to reduce the dimensionality of the joint video/audio inputs, which is done by selecting a smaller number of output features to be produced. The Combiner can be implemented simply as a causal Transformer, which processes the inputs in the direction of time, ie, using only inputs of the prior steps or the current one. Alternatively, the Combiner can have a learnable memory, described below. </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Combiner styles</h2>; <p>; A simple version of the Combiner adapts a Transformer architecture. More specifically, all audio and video features from the current chunk (and optionally prior chunks) are input to a Transformer and projected to a lower dimensionality, ie, a smaller number of features are selected as the output “combined” features. While Transformers are not typically used in this context, we find it effective for reducing the dimensionality of the input features, by selecting the last <em>;m</em>; outputs of the Transformer, if <em>;m</em>; is the desired output dimension (shown below). Alternatively, the Combiner can have a memory component. For example, we use the <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2211.09119">;Token Turing Machine</a>; (TTM), which supports a differentiable memory unit, accumulating and compressing features from all previous timesteps 。 Using a fixed memory allows the model to work with a more compact set of features at every step, rather than process all the features from previous steps, which reduces computation. </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Results</h2>; <p>; We evaluate our approach on several benchmarks, <a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/cvpr16.msr-vtt.tmei_-1.pdf">;MSRVTT-QA</a>;, <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.02467">;ActivityNet-QA</a>; and <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2105.08276">;NeXT-QA</a>;, for the video QA task, where a text-based question about a video is issued and the model needs to answer. This evaluates the ability of the model to understand both the text-based question and video content, and to form an answer, focusing on only relevant information. Of these benchmarks, the latter two target long video inputs and feature more complex questions. </p>; <p>; We also evaluate our approach in the more challenging open-ended text generation setting, wherein the model generates the answers in an unconstrained fashion as free form text, requiring an exact match to the ground truth answer. While this stricter evaluation counts synonyms as incorrect, it may better reflect a model's ability to generalize. </p>; <p>; Our results indicate improved performance over state-of-the-art approaches for most benchmarks, including all with open-ended generation evaluation — notable considering our model is only 3B parameters, considerably smaller than prior approaches, eg, Flamingo 80B. We used only video and text inputs to be comparable to other work. Importantly, our model can process 512 frames without needing to increase the model parameters, which is crucial for handling longer videos. Finally with the TTM Combiner, we see both better or comparable performance while reducing compute by 18%. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; benchmark, which features long videos for the video QA task.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Results on audio-video benchmarks</h2>; <p>; Results on the popular audio-video datasets <a href="https://www.robots.ox.ac.uk/~vgg/data/vggsound/">;VGG-Sound</a>; and <a href="https://epic-kitchens.github.io/epic-sounds/">;EPIC-SOUNDS</a>; are shown below. Since these benchmarks are classification-only, we treat them as an open-ended text generative setting where our model produces the text of the desired class; eg, for the class ID corresponding to the “playing drums” activity, we expect the model to generate the text “playing drums”. In some cases our approach outperforms the prior state of the art by large margins, even though our model outputs the results in the generative open-ended setting. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEilvMcRgE6UcfYVRrHeniJ4K7wlOvHHXB76h_2pJ63eNEZ-1LASKSIPsCx_hntsQPG7k619EQTpV5mgvt2EIezwqnLAbdnYOvatfMD0zq97fnW3pDuQz1TUjUiNt-b2Ka9z5z3bwPZWhnDgQFXNbYdqTzTP50qKvg99Qb6UsUee7dNZfuxOWsq-6HJjdOs6/s1200/image6.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: auto; We also compare the effects of pre-training. Because standard methods are ill-suited for processing longer video, this experiment is conducted for 32 frames and four chunks only, across all settings for fair comparison. We see that Mirasol3B's improvements are still valid for relatively short videos. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgjD4KZfUgaGluUNoSERSnuaHWMsbyx6AzHrgKrvDB1ZJxpOqNonvOzTI4hGVz4I8KZQT4aDLkQ6rvMjQIHJCY9otQIZHuSeoNK1ciQ2ALE3n1zYzQEvPdwUR_81uEDeD5U9DXDABK8ozbONAHkK0hZFMHS0j6IoumYfmjKI-M9ZHb76F2kHl-6XTPEn2eG/s1200/image4.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="742" data-original-width="1200" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgjD4KZfUgaGluUNoSERSnuaHWMsbyx6AzHrgKrvDB1ZJxpOqNonvOzTI4hGVz4I8KZQT4aDLkQ6rvMjQIHJCY9otQIZHuSeoNK1ciQ2ALE3n1zYzQEvPdwUR_81uEDeD5U9DXDABK8ozbONAHkK0hZFMHS0j6IoumYfmjKI-M9ZHb76F2kHl-6XTPEn2eG/s16000/image4.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Ablation experiments comparing the main components of our model. Using the Combiner, the autoregressive modeling, and pre-training all improve performance.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Conclusion </h2>; <p>; We present a multimodal autoregressive model that addresses the challenges associated with the heterogeneity of multimodal data by coordinating the learning between time-aligned and time-unaligned modalities. Time-aligned modalities are further processed autoregressively in time with a Combiner, controlling the sequence length and producing powerful representations. We demonstrate that a relatively small model can successfully represent long video and effectively combine with other modalities. We outperform the state-of-the-art approaches (including some much bigger models) on video- and audio-video question answering. </p>; <div style="line-height:40%;">; <br>; </div>; <h2>;Acknowledgements</h2>; <p>; <em>;This research is co-authored by AJ Piergiovanni, Isaac Noble, Dahun Kim, Michael Ryoo, Victor Gomes, and Anelia Angelova. studies for the research community</stitle>;<content type="html">;<span class="byline-author">;Posted by Chintan Ghate, Software Engineer, and Diana Mincu, Research Engineer, Google Research</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhDeCRv8m_GTaIXN2BwUWSYHbbj6g4jpo6TSJB6UYQsO-LLCbn6WeWceSXR01Ng1mFcHOifnZgb_Mn4IPoxy_5y1s8m3RUp_08hodTOz87SoQUh2wFjh7KhfKZbxyylB0c1iZfQVCQOn-laEBhjd96wTYlibS03ejrTEovnaYrWpBhb-A7RYtaLfcfJ9sKX/s1100/MSSignals-Hero.jpg" style="display: none;" />; <p>; As consumer technologies like <a href="https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/healthcare-life-sciences/google-cloud-fitbit-haga-collaborate-on-pilot-heart-study">;fitness trackers</a>; and <a href="https://blog.google/products/pixel/health-ai-better-sleep/">;mobile phones</a>; become more widely used for health-related data collection, so does the opportunity to leverage these data pathways to study and advance our understanding of medical conditions. We have <a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/11/responsible-ai-at-google-research.html">;previously</a>; touched upon how our work explores the use of this technology within the context of chronic diseases, in particular multiple sclerosis (MS). This effort leverages the <a href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/fda-mystudies">;FDA MyStudies platform</a>;, an open-source platform used to create clinical study apps, that makes it easier for anyone to run their own studies and collect good quality healthcare data, in a trusted and safe way. </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <p>; Today, we describe the setup that we developed by expanding the FDA MyStudies platform and demonstrate how it can be used to set up a digital health study. We also present our exploratory research study created through this platform, called MS Signals, which consists of a symptom tracking app for MS patients. The goal for this app is twofold: 1) to ensure that the enhancements to the FDA MyStudies platform made for a more streamlined study creation experience; and 2) to understand how new data collection mechanisms can be used to revolutionize patients' chronic disease management and tracking. We have <a href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/fda-mystudies-flutter">;open sourced</a>; our extension to the FDA MyStudies platform under the <a href="https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0">;Apache 2.0 license</a>; to provide a resource for the community to build their own studies. </p>; <br />; <h2>;Extending the FDA MyStudies platform</h2>; <p>; The original FDA MyStudies platform allowed people to configure their own study apps, manage participants, and create separate iOS and Android apps. To simplify the study creation process and ensure increased study engagement, we made a number of accessibility changes. Some of the main improvements include: cross-platform (iOS and Android) app generation through the use of <a href="https://flutter.dev/">;Flutter</a>;, an open source framework by Google for building multi-platform applications from a single codebase; a simplified setup, so that users can prototype their study quickly (under a day in most cases); and, most importantly, an emphasis on accessibility so that diverse patient's voices are heard. The accessibility enhancements include changes to the underlying features of the platform and to the particular study design of the MS Signals study app. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;多平台支持，快速原型制作</h3>; <p>; 我们决定使用 Flutter因为这将是一个可以一次性生成 iOS 和 Android 应用程序的单点，从而减少支持多个平台所需的工作。 Flutter 还提供了<a href="https://docs.flutter.dev/tools/hot-reload">;热重载</a>;，它允许开发者构建和加载。快速预览功能。应用程序中的设计系统利用此功能提供一个中心点，从该中心点进行品牌推广和设计。该应用程序的主题可以更改以匹配新研究的基调并立即预览。应用程序中的演示环境也利用此功能，允许开发人员在其计算机上本地模拟和预览调查问卷。根据我们的经验，这在与临床医生现场进行用户体验以及问题的格式和措辞 A/B 测试时节省了大量时间。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;系统辅助功能增强</h3>; <p>; 为了提高平台对更多用户的辅助功能，我们做了一些可用性增强：</p>; <ol>; <li>;Light &深色主题支持</li>; <li>;粗体文本和粗体文本可变字体大小</li>; <li>;高对比度模式</li>; <li>;提高用户对辅助功能设置的认识</li>; </ol>; <p>;长时间暴露在强光主题下可能会使眼睛疲劳，因此，支持深色主题功能是必要的，以便更轻松地频繁使用学习应用程序。一些小或轻的文本元素对于视力障碍的用户来说是难以辨认的，因此我们添加了 1) 粗体文本和对较大字体大小的支持以及 2) 高对比度颜色方案。为了确保易于找到辅助功能设置，我们放置了一个在应用程序首次启动时出现的介绍性一次性屏幕，该屏幕将直接将用户带到他们的系统辅助功能设置。 </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;研究辅助功能增强</h3>; <p>;使研究本身更易于交互并减少认知超载，我们进行了以下更改：</p>; <ol>; <li>;澄清了入职流程</li>; <li>;改进了问卷设计</li>; </ol>; <p>; 首先，我们澄清了通过在用户首次打开应用程序时向用户提供所需步骤列表来进行入职流程，以减少混乱和参与者流失。 </p>; <p>; 应用中最初的问卷设计以卡片的形式呈现每个问题，利用屏幕的一部分来实现卡片的阴影和深度效果。在许多情况下，这是一种令人愉悦的美感，但在优先考虑可访问性的应用程序中，这些视觉元素限制了屏幕上的可用空间。因此，当使用更易于访问、更大的字体大小时，会出现更频繁的断词，从而降低了可读性。我们简单地通过删除卡片设计元素并使用整个屏幕来解决此问题，从而通过更大的字体大小获得更好的视觉效果。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;MS Signals 原型研究</h2>; <p>; 为了测试这些更改的可用性，我们使用重新设计的平台创建了一个名为 MS Signals 的原型研究应用程序，该应用程序使用调查来收集有关参与者多发性硬化症相关症状的信息。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEikbf3GdEuJptK8hRicFp-sjYhfRZfYc3XyqEf7A3FDJZ_XTiDOBeMQXUYAtO5ZNoP7eI9GJRJS6zJfK9abPIFJC tOEYIOjBphF7qDqSCObwC7YpQ2BeLNTYtKFKyYGzM-h6wPrcyLA4QqLttVAsMd_B2lXxE47OxfBZJ4RgqLW7IfUqT3xlzcOKh2w_hzB/s1760/MSSignals.png"样式="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="1728" data-original-width="1760" height="628" src="https ://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEikbf3GdEuJptK8hRicFp-sjYhfRZfYc3XyqEf7A3FDJZ_XTiDOBeMQXUYAtO5ZNoP7eI9GJRJS6zJfK9abPIFJCtOEYIOjBphF7qDqSCObwC7Yp Q2BeLNTYtKFKyYGzM-h6wPrcyLA4QqLttVAsMd_B2lXxE47OxfBZJ4RgqLW7IfUqT3xlzcOKh2w_hzB/w640-h628/MSSignals.png" width="640" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr >;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;<em style="text-align: left;">;MS Signals 应用程序屏幕截图。</em>;</td>;</tr >;</tbody>;</table>; <!--<tablealign="center"cellpadding="0"cellspacing="0"class="tr-caption-container"style="margin-left:auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjeCBgKDha7HDQNbbG- dPx4AEoZfWd1SMYdzdZglFFkE_LbHA-_-rzwU1o1VbOvHE5aLMngCXs5AkCWp4jez0glZ1s7HFzK0deFGodiUWlj5xXhWQYGLEXOk94h2NlaSwjizkaY6jJgZfnDlngu69r4O01ifsils5Kf Od48G7wSSjvL5AYWbN9oiB4d79k​​7/s1999/image2.png" style="margin-left: 自动; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="1971" data-original-width="1999" height="632" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com /img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjeCBgKDha7HDQNbbG-dPx4AEoZfWd1SMYdzdZglFFkE_LbHA-_-rzwU1o1VbOvHE5aLMngCXs5AkCWp4jez0glZ1s7HFzK0deFGodiUWlj5xXhWQYGLEXOk94h2 NlaSwjizkaY6jJgZfnDlngu69r4O01ifsiLs5KfOd48G7wSSjvL5AYWbN9oiB4d79k​​7/w640-h632/image2.png" width="640" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class=" tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;<em style="text-align: left;">;MS Signals 应用程序屏幕截图。</em>;</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;< /table>;-->; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;MS Studies 应用程序设计</h3>; <p>; 作为第一步，在输入任何内容之前为了了解研究信息，参与者需要填写一份资格和研究理解调查问卷，以确保他们已经阅读了可能冗长的研究参与条款。这可能包括诸如“该研究在哪个国家/地区可用？”或“你可以退学吗？”这样的部分在大多数健康研究中都很常见，而且往往是参与者的第一个下车点。 </p>; <p>; 为了最大限度地减少早期阶段的学习流失，我们保持资格测试简短，并将理解测试的正确答案反映给参与者。这有助于最大限度地减少用户可能需要完成初始资格调查问卷的次数，并确保他们清楚了解研究方案的重要方面。 </p>; <p>; 成功注册后，参与者将进入主应用程序视图，其中包含三个页面：</p>; <ul>; <li>;<strong>;活动：</strong>; <br />;页面列出了参与者可用的调查问卷，并且是他们花费大部分时间的地方。调查问卷的频率各不相同——有些是为收集病史而创建的一次性调查，而另一些则每天、每周或每月重复一次，具体取决于他们正在探索的症状或领域。对于一次性调查，我们在每个问题上方提供一个计数器，向用户表明他们已经走了多远以及还剩下多少问题，类似于资格和理解步骤中的调查问卷。 </li>; <li>;<strong>;仪表板：</strong>; <br />; 为了确保参与者在研究期间输入的信息得到回报，仪表板区域以图表或形式显示他们的回答摘要。饼图形式。参与者可以向他们的护理人员展示这些数据，作为他们过去 6 个月的病情总结，这比许多人目前采用的传统笔和纸方法有所改进。 </li>; <li>;<strong>;资源：</strong>; <br />; 一组与 MS 相关的有用链接、帮助文章和常见问题。 </li>; </ul>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h3>;问卷设计</h3>; <p>;由于需要频繁输入数据会导致针对认知超载、参与者流失和数据质量差的问题，我们通过两种方式减轻了负担：</p>; <ol>; <li>;我们将大型调查问卷分解为较小的调查问卷，形成 6 项每日调查，其中包含 3-5 个调查问卷每个问题都是多项选择，并且与单一症状相关。通过这种方式，我们总共涵盖了 20 种主要症状，并以与临床医生在诊所中询问这些问题类似的方式呈现它们。</li>; <li>;我们确保之前输入的信息可以在应用程序，以及输入时间。</li>; </ol>; <p>; 在设计调查内容时，我们与经验丰富的临床医生和研究人员密切合作，最终确定了措辞和布局。虽然该领域的研究通常使用<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Likert_scale">;李克特量表</a>;来收集症状信息，但我们定义了更直观的详细量表以提供更好的体验供参与者跟踪其疾病以及临床医生或研究人员查看疾病史。例如，在视力问题的情况下，我们不是要求参与者按照从 1 到 10 的等级对他们的症状进行评分，而是提出一个多项选择问题，详细说明他们可能遇到的常见视力问题。 </p>; <p>; 这种详细的量表可以帮助患者更准确地跟踪他们的症状，包括帮助他们更清楚地定义症状的上下文。这种方法还允许研究人员回答超出症状相关性的问题。例如，对于视力问题，使用详细量表收集的数据将向研究人员揭示<a href="https://www.webmd.com/eye-health/nystagmus">;眼球震颤</a>;在患者中是否更为突出与MS相比复视。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiQHtaxn1OL9zKbNnPfUkfEmXV8zb2dR7HJaTezZrNyhN8D_V35gfHaLtQNjoBLBxIE5lP9eiB-mxXQ7Fqxb SB1d3tg​​TOB7fA7o6boudBmPzfiQ8CuKc117fBIFLuzem5Lo8938LqpQkxofoAL5bnpMD3hI4vOJNzHbbuB8b5RqoIP_zcD0dpr7IL9w3ysa/s1780/MSSignals-2.png"样式="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="1754" data-original-width="1780" height="630" src="https ://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiQHtaxn1OL9zKbNnPfUkfEmXV8zb2dR7HJaTezZrNyhN8D_V35gfHaLtQNjoBLBxIE5lP9eiB-mxXQ7FqxbSB1d3tg​​TOB7fA7o6boudBmPz fiQ8CuKc117fBIFLuzem5Lo8938LqpQkxofoAL5bnpMD3hI4vOJNzHbbuB8b5RqoIP_zcD0dpr7IL9w3ysa/w640-h630/MSSignals-2.png" width="640" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr >;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;<em style="text-align: left;">;与左侧的李克特量表并排比较，以及右侧详细比例。</em>;</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; </tr>;</tbody>;</table>;-->; <h2>;关注可访问性</h2>; <p>;基于移动设备的研究通常会给患有慢性病的参与者带来额外的挑战：文本可能难以阅读，颜色对比可能会让人很难看到某些信息，或者滚动浏览页面可能会很困难。这可能会导致参与者流失，反过来，如果经历更多信息的人可能会产生有偏见的数据集疾病的晚期形式无法提供数据。 </p>; <p>; 为了防止此类问题，我们提供了以下辅助功能：</p>; <ul>; <li>;自始至终，我们都采用色盲可访问的配色方案。这包括提高关键文本和重要附加信息之间的对比度，否则这些信息可能会以较小的字体和褪色的文本颜色呈现。</li>; <li>;我们通过放置所有按钮来减少访问关键控件所需的移动量靠近页面底部，并确保可以从屏幕底部控制弹出窗口。</li>; </ul>; <p>; 为了测试 MS Signals 的可访问性，我们与 <a href= “https://www.nationalmssociety.org/">;国家多发性硬化症协会</a>;招募用户体验研究参与者。为此，协会向其会员发出了参与号召，并要求 9 名受访者测试各种应用程序流程。大多数人表示，他们希望有一种比当前方法更好的方法来跟踪症状数据，他们认为 MS 信号是一种独特且有价值的工具，可以提高症状跟踪的准确性，并且他们希望分享与他们的医疗保健提供者的仪表板视图。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;后续步骤</h2>; <p>; 我们希望鼓励每个人都使用<a href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/fda-mystudies-flutter ">;开源</a>;平台开始建立和运行自己的研究。我们正在努力创建一套标准研究模板，其中将包含我们从上面学到的知识，我们希望尽快发布这些模板。如有任何问题、意见或疑问，请查看我们的<a href="https://goo.gle/ms-signals">;资源页面</a>;。 </p>;</content>;<link href="http://blog.research.google/feeds/5546775652504697591/comments/default" rel="replies" title="发表评论" type="application/atom+xml "/>;<link href="http://blog.research.google/2023/11/enabling-large-scale-health-studies-for.html#comment-form" rel="replies" title="0 条评论“ type =“text / html”/>;<link href =“http://www.blogger.com/feeds/8474926331452026626/posts/default/5546775652504697591”rel =“edit”type =“application/atom+xml”/ >;<link href="http://www.blogger.com/feeds/8474926331452026626/posts/default/5546775652504697591" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml"/>;<link href="http:// /blog.research.google/2023/11/enabling-large-scale-health-studies-for.html" rel="alternate" title="为研究界实现大规模健康研究" type="text/html "/>;<作者>;<名称>;Google AI</名称>;<uri>;http://www.blogger.com/profile/12098626514775266161</uri>;<电子邮件>;noreply@blogger.com</电子邮件>;<gd：图片高度=“16”rel=“http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#thumbnail”src=“https://img1.blogblog.com/img/b16-rounded.gif”宽度=“16” ">;</gd:image>;</author>;<media:thumbnail height="72" url="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhDeCRv8m_GTaIXN2BwUWSYHbbj6g4jpo6TSJB6UYQsO-LLCbn6WeWceSXR01Ng1mFcHOifnZgb_Mn4IPoxy_5 y1s8m3RUp_08hodTOz87SoQUh2wFjh7KhfKZbxyylB0c1iZfQVCQOn-laEBhjd96wTYlibS03ejrTEovnaYrWpBhb-A7RYtalfcfJ9sKX/s72- c/MSSignals-Hero.jpg" width="72" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">;</media:thumbnail>;<thr:total>;0</thr:total>; </entry>;<entry>;<id>;标签：blogger.com,1999:blog-8474926331452026626.post-7987071997778787277</id>;<已发布>;2023-11-09T14:23:00.000-08:00</已发布>;<更新>;2023-11-09T14:23:38.431-08:00</更新>;<category schema="http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#" term="Africa">;</category>;<类别方案=“http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#”术语=“健康”>;</类别>;<类别方案=“http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#”术语="RAI-HCT 亮点">;</category>;<title type="text">;Google 研究院的负责任人工智能：人工智能研究背景 (CAIR)</stitle>;<content type="html">;<span class=" byline-author">;由 Google Research 研究科学家 Katherine Heller 代表 CAIR 团队发布</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjN3mIK7184k0E4B4Pddafelrcf4yEqd1wTOxyK5LZlxKL8dFWwbEyATjS0Z bj8HBdAnIXQ40fVedg4O5oUi5_fVvOvKRQWhgIX05olZkb9YakVdRLXus3b9Pzze5oHu32X0VUpoykEvGwbZk9W2lEIJ8jUMlgzyML0yFFsyBbpbAUZgBk6TSli7bRaNQRs/s1100 /CAIR-hero.jpg" style="display: none;" />; <p>; 人工智能 (AI) 和相关的机器学习 (ML) 技术在我们周围的世界中的影响力越来越大，因此我们必须考虑我们所创造的技术的各个方面对社会和个人的潜在影响。为此，人工智能研究情境 (CAIR) 团队在整个人工智能管道的背景下开发新颖的人工智能方法：<strong>;</strong>;从数据到最终用户反馈。构建人工智能系统的流程通常从<em>;数据</em>;收集开始，然后设计<em>;模型</em>;在该数据上运行，<em>;部署</em>;模型现实世界，最后，编译和合并<em>;人类反馈</em>;。 CAIR 团队的工作起源于健康领域，现已扩展到其他领域，影响着该管道的各个方面。在专注于模型构建的同时，我们特别注重构建具有责任感的系统，包括公平性、稳健性、透明度和包容性。 </p>; <a name='more'>;</a>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto ; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEidxBmC -Vmh8A8AdqFMHkEIqz5pcp85_vX6uPteEiaF00boHGuUo3M45rtunHL58dOillPI_7Vn3BwxavTGbmPpWcUQorJsjY6x5gh8agM9jbPio8c29iFvYUgVhO1BkEsU5eg133JKfLkcQHN3FteC yeorkzS79e0u7TDig_xCv_B_36UYLfK7gx2pgtQK/s1050/CAIR.png" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="383" data-original-width="1050 “高度=“234”src=“https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEidxBmC-Vmh8A8AdqFMHkEIqz5pcp85_vX6uPteEiaF00boHGuUo3M45rtunHL58dOillPI_7Vn3BwxavTGbmPpWcUQorJsjY6x5 gh8agM9jbPio8c29iFvYUgVhO1BkEsU5eg133JKfLkcQHN3FteCyeorkzS79e0u7TDig_xCv_B_36UYLfK7gx2pgtQK/w640-h234/CAIR.png" width="640" />;</a>;</ td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <h2>;数据</h2>; <p>; CAIR 团队专注于理解构建机器学习系统的数据。提高机器学习数据集透明度的标准对我们的工作很有帮助。首先，我们采用文档框架来阐明数据集和模型特征，作为数据和模型文档技术开发的指导 - <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1803.09010">;数据集数据表</a>;和<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1810.03993">;用于模型报告的模型卡</a>;。 </p>; <p>; 例如，健康数据集高度敏感，但影响很大。为此，我们开发了<a href="https://dl.acm.org/doi/fullHtml/10.1145/3531146.3533239">;健康表</a>;，这是数据表的健康情境改编版。我们开发健康特定表的动机在于现有人工智能和健康监管框架的局限性。 <a href="https://www.nejm.org/doi/10.1056/NEJMp1816373">;最近的研究</a>;表明数据隐私监管和标准（例如，<a href="https://en.wikipedia .org/wiki/Health_Insurance_Portability_and_Accountability_Act">;HIPAA</a>;、<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_Data_Protection_Regulation">;GDPR</a>;、<a href="https://en .wikipedia.org/wiki/California_Consumer_Privacy_Act">;加州消费者隐私法</a>;）不确保数据收集、记录和使用符合道德规范。 Healthsheets 旨在填补道德数据集分析中的这一空白。 Healthsheets 的开发是与相关工作角色的许多利益相关者合作完成的，包括临床、法律和监管、生物伦理、隐私和产品。 </p>; <p>; 此外，我们研究了数据表和健康表如何作为诊断工具来揭示数据集的局限性和优势。我们的目标是在社区中发起对话，并根据不断变化的医疗保健场景定制健康表。 </p>; <p>; 为了促进这项工作，我们加入了 <a href="http://www.datadiversity.org/">;STANDING Together</a>; 倡议，这是一个旨在开发<a href= "https://www.nature.com/articles/s41591-022-01987-w">;基于共识的国际标准，用于记录健康数据集中的多样性和代表性</a>;，并就如何降低风险提供指导偏见转化为伤害和健康不平等。作为这一跨越全球学术、临床、监管、政策、行业、患者和慈善组织的国际跨学科合作伙伴关系的一部分，我们能够参与有关国际医疗保健人工智能责任的对话。来自 32 个国家/地区的 250 多个利益相关者为完善标准做出了贡献<strong>;。</strong>; </p>; <tablealign="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container " style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent. com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjUogIg5rJu-5i259KxpG9DrCD7an9L1KTpugqjw__6LWGUIF-78hkPUpjbUWc8SAZ7BZk82RlI7ddaW3Fe9spfn-hbyNLk94LAFWb3XvynnbLJddwxv8sSd0 swacF5_C6UV2NjM0FXzLWKiYDnW3F_SjyOvUVp0BO2YADXBqbabbUP5D7X1i5czhqfrOcw/s1050/Healthsheets.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-高度=“731”数据原始宽度=“1050”src=“https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjUogIg5rJu-5i259KxpG9DrCD7an9L1KTpugqjw__6LWGUIF-78hkPUpjbUWc8SAZ7BZk82RlI7ddaW3Fe 9spfn-hbyNLk94LAFWb3XvynnbLJddwxv8sSd0swacF5_C6UV2NjM0FXzLWKiYDnW3F_SjyOvUVp0BO2YADXBqbabbUP5D7X1i5czhqfrOcw/s16000/Healthsheets.png"/>;< /a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;<em style="text-align: left;">;健康表和站立共同：迈向健康数据文档和标准。</em>;</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <h2>;模型</h2>; <p>; 当机器学习系统部署在在现实世界中，他们可能无法按照预期的方式行事，在新的环境中做出糟糕的预测。发生此类故障的原因有多种，并可能带来负面后果，特别是在医疗保健领域。我们的工作旨在在意外模型行为成为重大问题之前识别可能会发现的情况，并减轻意外和不良后果。 </p>; <p>; CAIR 团队的大部分建模工作侧重于识别和缓解模型<a href="https://blog.research.google/2021/10/how-underspecation-presents.html">;未指定</a>;。我们表明，在从训练域提取的保留数据上表现良好的模型在分布偏移下并不同样稳健或公平，因为这些模型依赖虚假相关性的程度各不相同。这给用户和从业者带来了风险，因为使用标准模型评估实践很难预测模型的不稳定性。 <a href="https://www.jmlr.org/papers/v23/20-1335.html">;我们已经证明</a>;这种担忧出现在多个领域，包括计算机视觉、自然语言处理、医学成像和电子健康记录预测。 </p>; <p>; 我们还展示了如何利用因果机制的知识来诊断和减轻新环境中的公平性和稳健性问题。了解因果结构使从业者能够预测真实分布变化下公平性属性的普遍性-世界医疗环境</a>;。此外，通过研究特定因果路径或“捷径”在机器学习系统中引入偏差的能力，我们演示了如何识别<a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-023- 39902-7">;捷径学习</a>;导致机器学习系统中的预测无意中依赖于敏感属性（例如年龄、性别、种族）。我们已经展示了如何使用因果<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Directed_acycl_graph">;有向无环图</a>;来<a href="https://proceedings.mlr.press/ v206/alabdulmohsin23a">;使机器学习系统适应复杂的分布变化形式下不断变化的环境</a>;。我们的团队目前正在研究如何对不同形式的偏差进行因果解释，包括<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Selection_bias">;选择偏差</a>;、标签偏差和测量误差， <a href="https://nips.cc/virtual/2022/58452">;激励技术设计，以减少模型开发和评估过程中的偏差</a>;。 </p>; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="382" data-original-width="1078" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/ R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEi_HHXvW2hIuenXNIkORatVFSgqfaqBJbbsqFqlWCYTdfOR9RwTVqhTxGqqSPBwUhy24wYAlKn9j-vpDCths0heIL7WQk5xVxkj1OHzJpZrzZVebGB6wAP-Won7NImE6drZjMi SchFM5JdYJulLZULSHuVEjX10-wnhOANX9BsRefZiL0v0vH4E2lU1eW2n/s16000/image1.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center ;">;<em style="text-align: left;">;快捷学习：对于某些模型，年龄可能是使用医学图像时分类的快捷方式。</em>;</td>;</tr>;</ tbody>;</table>; <br />; <p>; CAIR团队专注于开发方法论来广泛构建更具包容性的模型。例如，我们还有<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2302.03874" >;致力于参与式系统的设计</a>;，该系统允许个人在机器学习系统进行预测时选择是否披露种族等敏感属性。我们希望我们的方法论研究能够积极影响社会对人工智能包容性的理解方法开发。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;部署</h2>; <p>; CAIR 团队的目标是构建通过使用移动设备技术来改善所有人生活的技术。我们的目标是减少健康状况带来的痛苦，解决系统性不平等问题，并实现基于设备的透明数据收集。随着健身追踪器和手机等消费技术成为健康数据收集的核心，我们探索了这些技术在慢性疾病背景下的使用，特别是<a href="https://en.wikipedia .org/wiki/Multiple_sclerosis">;多发性硬化症</a>;（MS）。我们开发了新的数据收集机制和预测，我们希望最终能够彻底改变患者的慢性病管理、临床试验、医疗逆转和药物开发。 </p>; <p>; 首先，我们扩展了开源 <a href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/fda-mystudies">;FDA MyStudies 平台</a>;，用于创建临床研究应用程序，使任何人都可以更轻松地以可信且安全的方式进行自己的研究并收集高质量的数据。我们的改进包括零配置设置，以便研究人员可以在一天内对他们的研究进行原型设计，通过使用 <a href="https://flutter.dev/">;Flutter</a>; 生成跨平台应用程序，以及，最重要的是，强调可及性，以便所有患者的声音都能被听到。我们很高兴地宣布这项工作现已<a href="https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/fda-mystudies-flutter">;开源</a>;，作为原始 FDA-Mystudies 平台的扩展。您今天就可以开始建立自己的学习！ </p>; <p>; 为了测试这个平台，我们构建了一个原型应用程序，我们称之为 MS Signals，它使用调查在新颖的消费者环境中与患者进行交互。我们与<a href="https://www.nationalmssociety.org/">;国家多发性硬化症协会</a>;合作，招募参与者参与该应用程序的用户体验研究，目标是降低退出率并改善平台更进一步。 </p>; 欢迎学习<strong>;右：</strong>; 问卷。</em>;</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <br />; <p>; 收集数据后，研究人员可能会用它来推动 MS 机器学习研究的前沿。在另一项研究中，我们与<a href="https://neurology.duke.edu/">;杜克大学神经病学系</a>;建立了研究合作，并证明机器学习模型可以<a href="https: //www.researchsquare.com/article/rs-2547289/v1">;使用从移动应用程序持续收集的数据，准确预测三个月内严重症状的发生率</a>;。结果表明，临床医生可以使用经过训练的模型来评估多发性硬化症参与者的症状轨迹，这可能为实施干预措施的决策提供信息。 </p>; <p>; CAIR 团队参与了许多其他系统的部署，供内部和外部使用。例如，我们还与 <a href="https://learningally.org/">;Learning Ally</a>; 合作<a href="https://ai.googleblog.com/2023/08/study -socially-aware-temporally-causal.html">;为患有学习障碍（例如阅读障碍）的儿童建立图书推荐系统</a>;。我们希望我们的工作对未来的产品开发产生积极影响。 </p>; <br />; <h2>;人类反馈</h2>; <p>; 随着机器学习模型在发达国家变得无处不在，欠发达国家的声音可能很容易被忽视。 CAIR团队的优先事项是弥合这一差距，与社区建立深厚的关系，并通过社区驱动的方法共同努力解决与ML有关的问题。 </p>; <p>;我们这样做的一种方法之一是与ML的基层组织合作，例如<a href="https://www.sisonkebiotik.africa/home">; sisonkebiotik </a>;，在ML和医疗保健的交汇处，一个开放且包容性的研究人员，从业者和爱好者共同努力，共同建立能力并推动非洲前进的研究计划。我们与SisonKebiotik社区合作，详细介绍了历史自上而下的全球健康方法的局限性，并建议采用基于互补的健康方法，特别是基层参与式社区（GPC）的方法。我们共同创建了一个<a href="https://openreview.net/forum?id=jhy_g91r880">;用于ML和全球健康的框架关于<a href="https://www.masakhane.io/">; masakhane </a>;，Sisonkebiotik和<a href =“ https://ro-ya-cv4africa.github。 io/homepage/“>; ro'ya </a>;。 </p>; <p>;我们正在采取公开倡议，以更好地了解非西方国家/地区的人工智能对健康的作用，看法和用例，并在非洲最初重点关注。与<a href="https://ghananlp.org/">;加纳NLP </a>;一起，我们努力详细介绍<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2304.02190">;在非西方环境中，更好地了解算法公平和健康的偏见</a>;。我们最近启动了一项研究，以使用人类反馈来扩展这项工作。 </p>; </category>; <title type =“ text”>;克服错误校正的量子处理器上的泄漏<span class="byline-author">;Posted by Kevin Miao and Matt McEwen, Research Scientists, Quantum AI Team</span>; <img src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEidYny_9v0IyOBy7QbYVgwS5FAHzgHhVUt5FQvjXhi6WWJHyIIal3awBfaXNu9l3g47HElKNkFNf6XfpU7a_9ExGLlKFgOWvUOaT0PLhEoCfofJrazqT2IL1fBMtZMwfGJSnrpBrQZwQkYJOV6iMOmhWBWIH5OCPcsEPkgw -luipdbolytoggin3hjfpmwr/s320/Quantum％20leakage.jpg“ style =“ display：none;” />; <p>; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/qubit">; qubits </a>; </a>; <a>; Google Quantum设备</a>;既精致又嘈杂，因此有必要合并错误校正程序，以识别并说明构建有用的量子计算机的量子错误。最普遍的两个错误机制是<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/wiki/quantum_error_eror_correction#bit_flip_code">; bit-flip_code">; bit-flip errors </a>; a href =“ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/quantum_error_correction#sign_flip_code”>; phode-flip errors </a>;（其中编码量子信息的相位更改的相位）。 <a href="https://blog.research.google/2021/08/demstrating-fundamentals-of-quantum.html">;量子错误校正</a>;（qec）有望解决并减轻这两个突出的错误。但是，还有各种各样的错误机制来挑战QEC的有效性。 </p>; <a name='more'>; </a>; <p>; <p>;当我们希望量子量作为理想<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/wiki/two-state_quantum_system">;两个 - 级别的系统</a>;没有损失机制，实际上并非如此。我们使用量子的最低能量水平（形成<em>;计算基础</em>;）来执行计算。这两个级别对应于量子中激发的缺失（计算基态）或存在（计算激发态），并标记为|0⟩（“ <a href =” https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki.org/wiki /bra％e2％80％93Ket_notation“>; ket </a>;零”）和|1⟩（“ ket One”）。但是，我们的Qubits还拥有许多称为<em>; <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/1509.05470">;泄漏状态</a>; </em>;的更高级别。按照标记级别标记的惯例，指示量子量中有多少激励，我们将其指定为|2⟩，|3⟩，|4⟩等等。 </p>; <p>;在“ <a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41567-023-02226-w">;克服量子错误校正中的泄漏</a>;” em>; <a href="https://www.nature.com/nphys/">;自然物理学</a>; </a>; </em>;，我们确定何时以及如何将量子泄漏到更高的状态各州可以通过我们的两个Qubit大门腐蚀附近的Qubits。然后，我们识别并实施一种策略，该策略可以消除泄漏并将其转换为QEC可以有效修复的错误。最后，我们表明这些操作显着改善了QEC过程的性能和稳定性。最后的结果特别关键，因为其他操作需要时间，通常会导致更多错误。 </p>; <div style =“ line-height：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </>; </div>; <h2>;与不完美的Qubits一起工作</h2>; <p>;我们的量子处理器是由称为<的超导量子构建的em>; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/wiki/transmon">; transmons </a>; </em>;。与理想的量子量量只有两个计算级别（计算基础状态和计算激发态）不同，Transmon Qubt具有比计算激发态更高能量的额外状态。这些较高的泄漏状态对于产生<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/wiki/quantum_entanglement">;纠缠</a>;的特定操作很有用</a>;太非线性和难以操作。但是，通过各种过程，也可以无意间将Transmon击中这些泄漏状态，包括我们应用用于操作的对照脉冲中的缺陷，或者是从低温冰箱中剩下的少量流量剩余的。这些过程集体称为<em>;泄漏</em>;，它描述了量子量从计算状态到泄漏状态的过渡。 </p>; <p>;考虑在QEC实验中广泛使用的特定两倍操作：<a href =“ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/wiki/wiki/list_of_quantum_quantum_quantum_logic_gates_gates 5B1％5D-，受控％2DZ，-％2C％0ACONTROLLOLLED％20SIGN“>; CZ GATE </a>;。该门在两个量子位上运行，当两个量子位在其|1⟩级别中时，相互作用会导致两个单独的激发在其中一个量子位中简短地“束”形成|2⟩，而另一个量子则变为| 0 ⟩，在返回到每个量子位在|1⟩中的原始配置之前。这束束缚了CZ门的纠缠力量。但是，只要概率很小，门就会遇到错误，激发没有返回其原始配置，从而导致操作在|2⟩（泄漏状态）中留下量子。当我们执行数百个或更多这些CZ门时，这种小的泄漏误差概率会累积。 </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>; <tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjnq7iPbsqcqffIGk3VgmUsIycfrYFQdyArF3RlBEdRKjJigk0mLym_E0OK_GZwix040pxZSPdZYr8loGNaX4An1pwtMGSiPIWruSj-S6Nleklj7YF9Y61fOtmsgl5pbeKIZCOLcWr4_4bQjZoBHz4zPNkBelyF-ZW0aUJDBpIQdamwg7VYWZxeCNk0q57L/s559/image1.png" style =“边距 - 左：自动;边缘右：自动;”>; <img border =“ 0” data-Original-height =“ 559” data-Original-width =“ 559” 559“ height =” 400“ src =” src =“ https ://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjnq7iPbsqcqffIGk3VgmUsIycfrYFQdyArF3RlBEdRKjJigk0mLym_E0OK_GZwix040pxZSPdZYr8loGNaX4An1pwtMGSiPIWruSj-S6Nleklj7YF9Y61fOtmsgl5pbeKIZCOLcWr4_4bQjZoBHz4zPNkBelyF-ZW0aUJDBpIQdamwg7VYWZxeCNk0q57L/w400-h400/image1.png" width="400" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr >; <td class =“ tr-caption” style =“ text-align：center;”>; transmon Qubits支持许多泄漏状态（|2⟩，|3⟩，|4⟩，…）超出计算基础（|0⟩和|1⟩）。虽然我们通常仅使用计算基础来表示量子信息，但有时量子位进入这些泄漏状态，并破坏我们的Qubits的正常操作。</td>; </tr>; </tr>; </tbody>; </table>; </table>; <br />; <p>;单个泄漏事件特别损坏了正常的量子操作，因为它会引起许多单独的错误。当一个量子位以泄漏的状态启动时，CZ门不再正确纠缠量子，从而阻止算法正确执行。不仅如此，在泄漏状态下应用于一个Qubit的CZ门也会导致另一个量子泄漏，从而通过设备扩散泄漏。我们的工作包括造成泄漏的方式以及与我们在量子处理器中使用的各种操作相互作用的广泛表征。 </p>; <p>;一旦Qubit进入泄漏状态，它可以保留在该状态下进行许多操作，然后再放松回到计算状态。这意味着一个单个泄漏事件会干扰该量子的许多操作，从而创建了随时间堆在一起的操作错误（<em>;时间相关</em>;错误）。通过CZ门在设备中不同量子位之间泄漏的能力，这意味着我们同时看到了相邻量子位上的一堆错误（<em>; space与空间相关的错误</em>;错误）。泄漏引起空间和时间相关的错误模式的事实使得从QEC算法的角度诊断和纠正尤其难以诊断。 </p>; <div style =“线路高：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </>; </>; <a href="https://blog.research.google/2023/02/suppressing-quantum-errors-erors-erors-erors-scaling.html">; Surface Code Qec Qec Qec </a>;，一套应用于一套不完美的操作物理Qubits形成A <em>;逻辑量子</em>;，其属性更接近理想的量子。简而言之，我们使用一组称为<em>; data Qubits </em>;的Qubits保存量子信息，而另一组<em>; MEAKE QUBITS </em>;检查了数据量量表，报告它们是否报告了遭受了任何错误，而不会破坏数据量量的微妙量子状态。 QEC的主要基础假设之一是，每个操作都独立发生错误，但是泄漏可以持续在许多操作上，并导致多个错误的相关模式。当泄漏导致这种假设违反时，我们的QEC策略的性能受到了限制。 </p>; jenga </em>;砖块，而无需倒出整个塔。 </p>; <p>;通过仔细测量我们的Transmon网格上的泄漏状态的群体，我们发现DQLR可以将所有量子位的平均泄漏状态人口降低到约0.1％，而没有它的近1％。重要的是，我们不再观察到数据量置量的泄漏量的逐渐增加，在使用DQLR之前，泄漏量始终在某种程度上存在。 </p>; <p>;但是，这个结果只是难题的一半。如前所述，可以使用诸如MLR之类的操作来有效地消除数据量位上的泄漏，但也将完全消除存储的量子状态。我们还需要证明DQLR与逻辑量子状态的保存兼容。 </p>; <p>;当代深度学习模型在许多领域都非常成功，从自然语言到计算机视觉。 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/transformer_(machine_learning_model)">;变形金刚神经网络</a>;（变形金刚）是一种流行的深度学习体系结构，如今已构成自然语言基础的基础处理并开始扩展到其他域中的应用程序，例如<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2010.11929">;计算机视觉</a>;，<a href =“ 。自动驾驶/“>;自动驾驶</a>;。此外，它们形成了所有当前最新的<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/wiki/language_model">;语言模型</a>;的骨干。 </p>; <a name='more'>; </a>; <p>;变压器网络中的规模提高导致性能提高，<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/abs/2206.07682">;出现行为</a>;不存在于较小的网络中。但是，规模的增加通常会导致计算成本和推理潜伏期的过高增加。一个自然的问题是，我们是否可以在不承担计算负担的情况下获得大型模型的好处。 </p>; <p>;在“ <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.13310">;有效变压器的交替更新</a>;”中，被视为pashiglight at <a href =“ https：https：https：https： //neurips.cc/virtual/2023/poster/72994">; Neurips 2023 </a>;，我们介绍了Altup，一种方法，可以利用增加令牌表示而不增加计算成本。 Altup易于实现，广泛适用于任何变压器体系结构，并且需要最小的<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/hyperparameter_optimization">; HyperParameter Tuning </a>;。例如，在770m参数T5-LARGE模型上使用Altup的变体，添加〜100个参数会产生一个质量明显更高的模型。 </p>; <div style =“ line-height：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </>;工作。首先，它们将输入分为一系列令牌。然后将每个令牌映射到称为令牌嵌入的嵌入向量（通过嵌入表的均值）。我们将该向量的维度称为令牌表示维度。然后，通过使用其网络参数应用一系列计算模块（称为layers <em>;）</em>;，将变压器按照令牌嵌入序列进行操作。每个变压器层中的参数数是该层的<em>; width </em>;的函数，该函数由令牌表示尺寸确定。 </p>; <p>;要在不产生计算负担的情况下实现比例的好处，例如稀疏的Experts（稀疏MOE）型号（例如，<a href =” https://arxiv.org/abs /2101.03961">;开关变压器</a>;，<a href="https://blog.research.google/2022/11/mixture-of-11/mixture-of-experts-with-experts-with-expert-choice.html？选择</a>;，<a href="https://blog.research.google/2022/01/scaling-vision-vision-vision-with-sparse-mixuter-of.html?m = 1">; v-moe </a >;）主要集中于有效地扩大网络参数（在自我注意力中，在<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/wiki/feedforward_neural_network">; foreforward ">; fefforward layers </a>;）基于输入的子集。这使我们可以扩大网络大小而不会显着增加每个输入的计算。但是，通过有条件地激活令牌表示向量的部分来扩大令牌表示维度本身的研究差距。 </p>; <p>;最近的作品（例如，<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2001.08361">;缩放法律</a>;和<a href =“ https://arxiv.org.org /abs/2011.14522">; infinite-width网络）</a>;从经验和理论上确定，更广泛的令牌表示有助于学习更复杂的功能。这种现象在提高能力的现代体系结构中也很明显。例如，表示维度在<a href =“ https：//arxiv.org/1910.106833中，表示尺寸从512（small）提高到768（基本）和1024（基本）和1024（分别为770m，3b和11b参数的型号） “>; T5型号</a>;，从4096（8B）到8192（64b）和18432（540b），in <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2204.02311">; palm Models </a>; 。扩大的表示维度也显着提高了双重编码器检索模型的性能。但是，天真地扩大表示矢量需要相应地增加模型维度，而二次<sup id =“ fnref1”>; <a href="#fn1" rel=" rel="footnote">; 1 </a>; </a>; </sup>;增加馈电计算中的计算量。 </p>; <div style =“ line-height：40％;”>; <br />; </>; </>; </div>; <h2>;方法</h2>; <p>; altup通过将加宽的表示向量划分为相等尺寸的块， processing only a single block at each layer, and using an efficient prediction-correction mechanism to infer the outputs of the other blocks (shown below on the right). This allows AltUp to simultaneously keep the model dimension, hence the computation cost, roughly constant and take advantage of using an increased token dimension. The increased token dimension allows the model to pack more information into each token's embedding. By keeping the width of each transformer layer constant, AltUp avoids incurring the quadratic increase in computation cost that would otherwise be present with a naïve expansion of the representation. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiA3Jus4rPOjc_P58AjvIw6pUlQn8O4H828q_VFXYW2-dHxVQbfrMtplwmTy-s8gPCQTg4_Cd5mOrxZHGKhFswEC3gjGs_ffzRsBLkbyzDUDiRDUe1OncBGayjX4JVpfNNTtG8RVu3r9MYaG0nx1TxzeLGvZhxKC5ySlN8GTR1LN5rSvwXIdkqGEaCvuegv/s1367/image2.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="823" data-original-width="1367" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiA3Jus4rPOjc_P58AjvIw6pUlQn8O4H828q_VFXYW2-dHxVQbfrMtplwmTy-s8gPCQTg4_Cd5mOrxZHGKhFswEC3gjGs_ffzRsBLkbyzDUDiRDUe1OncBGayjX4JVpfNNTtG8RVu3r9MYaG0nx1TxzeLGvZhxKC5ySlN8GTR1LN5rSvwXIdkqGEaCvuegv/s16000/image2.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;An illustration of widening the token representation without (<b>;left</b>;) and with AltUp (<b>;right</b>;). This widening causes a near-quadratic increase in computation in a vanilla transformer due to the increased layer width. In contrast, Alternating Updates keeps the layer width constant and efficiently computes the output by operating on a sub-block of the representation at each layer.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <p>; More specifically, the input to each layer is two or more blocks, one of which is passed into the 1x width transformer layer (see figure below). We refer to this block as the “activated” block. This computation results in the exact output for the activated block. In parallel, we invoke a lightweight predictor that computes a weighted combination of all the input blocks. The predicted values, along with the computed value of the activated block, are passed on to a lightweight corrector that updates the predictions based on the observed values. This correction mechanism enables the inactivated blocks to be updated as a function of the activated one. Both the prediction and correction steps only involve a limited number of vector additions and multiplications and hence are much faster than a regular transformer layer. We note that this procedure can be generalized to an arbitrary number of blocks. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgGWWOVTTIeC_BqXAmfpdePJlLKoDIQdvT38SNyv6bepjrKJG8TjCqWVW1nwJMxNdE0JPaRaCvic5tE4xVYLX6Yg0wRkeucBD1u0PYKNBQ1BEmZ7YbO10IzWuOU-y8idTPYzDg69HVPqWaH3WIvMqgC4u0nucCp_0O5VsSKP1DqwzeVZAkQj3nA7wgsw4vN/s957/image3.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="504" data-original-width="957" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEgGWWOVTTIeC_BqXAmfpdePJlLKoDIQdvT38SNyv6bepjrKJG8TjCqWVW1nwJMxNdE0JPaRaCvic5tE4xVYLX6Yg0wRkeucBD1u0PYKNBQ1BEmZ7YbO10IzWuOU-y8idTPYzDg69HVPqWaH3WIvMqgC4u0nucCp_0O5VsSKP1DqwzeVZAkQj3nA7wgsw4vN/s16000/image3.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;The predictor and corrector computations: The predictor mixes sub-blocks with trainable scalar coefficients; the corrector returns a weighted average of the predictor output and the transformer output. The predictor and corrector perform scalar-vector multiplications and incur negligible computation cost compared to the transformer. The predictor outputs a linear mixing of blocks with scalar mixing coefficients p<sub>;i, j</sub>; , and the corrector combines predictor output and transformer output with weights g<sub>;i</sub>;.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <p>; At a higher level, AltUp is similar to sparse MoE in that it is a method to add capacity to a model in the form of conditionally accessed (external) parameters. In sparse MoE, the additional parameters take the form of feed forward network (FFN) experts and the conditionality is with respect to the input. In AltUp, the external parameters come from the widened embedding table and the conditionality takes the form of alternating block-wise activation of the representation vector, as in the figure above. Hence, AltUp has the same underpinning as sparse MoE models. </p>; <p>; An advantage of AltUp over sparse MoE is that it does not necessitate sharding since the number of additional parameters introduced is a factor<sup id="fnref2">;<a href="#fn2" rel="footnote">;2</a>;</sup>; of the embedding table size, which typically makes up a small fraction of the overall model size. Moreover, since AltUp focuses on conditionally activating parts of a wider token representation, it can be applied synergistically with orthogonal techniques like MoE to obtain complementary performance gains. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Evaluation</h2>; <p>; AltUp was evaluated on T5 models on various benchmark language tasks. Models augmented with AltUp are uniformly faster than the extrapolated dense models at the same accuracy. For example, we observe that a T5 Large model augmented with AltUp leads to a 27%, 39%, 87%, and 29% speedup on <a href="https://gluebenchmark.com/">;GLUE</a>;, <a href="https://super.gluebenchmark.com/">;SuperGLUE</a>;, <a href="https://rajpurkar.github.io/SQuAD-explorer/">;SQuAD</a>;, and <a href="https://nlp.cs.washington.edu/triviaqa/">;Trivia-QA</a>; benchmarks, respectively. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhOoxdT_-82XpER17MuIVo3MNk4EcD-gFd-WDK1PVoKzfwxh8z86-b_JHf5HNvlJAmaATyIsAxJJ8Fm96KJxBXwIf290qZcTzBEEa21lObPv4tGoinpHbGCFlzoVJsZnGkb9g7sb268t3Ut6z1DhzWz790GD1wulkLB2-vs4qIvL08chhMiLj8RZhyphenhyphenwWX7b/s1386/image5.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="982" data-original-width="1386" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhOoxdT_-82XpER17MuIVo3MNk4EcD-gFd-WDK1PVoKzfwxh8z86-b_JHf5HNvlJAmaATyIsAxJJ8Fm96KJxBXwIf290qZcTzBEEa21lObPv4tGoinpHbGCFlzoVJsZnGkb9g7sb268t3Ut6z1DhzWz790GD1wulkLB2-vs4qIvL08chhMiLj8RZhyphenhyphenwWX7b/s16000/image5.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Evaluations of AltUp on T5 models of various sizes and popular benchmarks. AltUp consistently leads to sizable speedups relative to baselines at the same accuracy. Latency is measured on <a href="https://cloud.google.com/tpu/docs/system-architecture-tpu-vm">;TPUv3</a>; with 8 cores. Speedup is defined as the change in latency divided by the AltUp latency (B = T5 Base, L = T5 Large, XL = T5 XL models).</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <p>; AltUp's relative performance improves as we apply it to larger models — compare the relative speedup of T5 Base + AltUp to that of T5 Large + AltUp. This demonstrates the scalability of AltUp and its improved performance on even larger models. Overall, AltUp consistently leads to models with better predictive performance than the corresponding baseline models with the same speed on all evaluated model sizes and benchmarks. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Extensions: Recycled AltUp</h2>; <p>; The AltUp formulation adds an insignificant amount of per-layer computation, however, it does require using a wider embedding table. In certain scenarios where the vocabulary size (ie, the number of distinct tokens the tokenizer can produce) is very large, this may lead to a non-trivial amount of added computation for the initial embedding lookup and the final <a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://developers.google.com/machine-learning/crash-course/multi-class-neural-networks/softmax&sa=D&source=docs&ust=1699300629405641&usg=AOvVaw3tnZ18-LvY0tPP_NClQ_P-">;linear + softmax operation</a>;. A very large vocabulary may also lead to an undesirable amount of added embedding parameters. To address this, Recycled-AltUp is an extension of AltUp that avoids these computational and parameter costs by keeping the embedding table's width the same. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEha4G9LHEhhkFzDTHspvL4DKoYq3BDO7KJfkEY3oy4AAOOHJnNmM0pYp_JjmUiuVTjAAddCowxzCLlcAA7CNKIwId8pujnAXoUMH2kM7ecQLHLfRyfqSqC5RKI-7yHwo8SaXN_CCQzVSHxldF7phMVY7CiaHUYIFIpMdWxpwBAZSpQem1RmBkyvEdjUYg2K/s989/image4.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="515" data-original-width="989" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEha4G9LHEhhkFzDTHspvL4DKoYq3BDO7KJfkEY3oy4AAOOHJnNmM0pYp_JjmUiuVTjAAddCowxzCLlcAA7CNKIwId8pujnAXoUMH2kM7ecQLHLfRyfqSqC5RKI-7yHwo8SaXN_CCQzVSHxldF7phMVY7CiaHUYIFIpMdWxpwBAZSpQem1RmBkyvEdjUYg2K/s16000/image4.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Illustration of the Architecture for Recycled-AltUp with <em>;K</em>; = 2.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <p>; In Recycled-AltUp, instead of widening the initial token embeddings, we replicate the embeddings <em>;K</em>; times to form a wider token representation. Hence, Recycled-AltUp adds virtually no additional parameters relative to the baseline transformer, while benefiting from a wider token representation. </p>; <table align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="tr-caption-container" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<tbody>;<tr>;<td style="text-align: center;">;<a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhRoANGe48-HncQDuNpxAVSUGf2GPp1qp6KpnvqMbQ5Mejlq4gWpq96vu9FxkDub8aO3RqYyDmTki2Xqkj9drOprwqrHDyoQvHI4oziYFguhDnkkYZO4GXdhAKgIlfffHJ5Po7mEVGCaAkOH7oobnt-8qKjWlerZp4EeoAjZg6IG_CEVO3hhsQvlPaV2GHU/s1999/image1.png" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;">;<img border="0" data-original-height="643" data-original-width="1999" src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhRoANGe48-HncQDuNpxAVSUGf2GPp1qp6KpnvqMbQ5Mejlq4gWpq96vu9FxkDub8aO3RqYyDmTki2Xqkj9drOprwqrHDyoQvHI4oziYFguhDnkkYZO4GXdhAKgIlfffHJ5Po7mEVGCaAkOH7oobnt-8qKjWlerZp4EeoAjZg6IG_CEVO3hhsQvlPaV2GHU/s16000/image1.png" />;</a>;</td>;</tr>;<tr>;<td class="tr-caption" style="text-align: center;">;Recycled-AltUp on T5-B/L/XL compared to baselines. Recycled-AltUp leads to strict improvements in pre-training performance without incurring any perceptible slowdown.</td>;</tr>;</tbody>;</table>; <p>; We also evaluate the lightweight extension of AltUp, Recycled-AltUp, with <em>;K</em>; = 2 on T5 base, large, and XL models and compare its pre-trained accuracy and speed to those of baselines. Since Recycled-AltUp does not require an expansion in the embedding table dimension, the models augmented with it have virtually the same number of trainable parameters as the baseline models. We again observe consistent improvements compared to the dense baselines. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>; <h2>;Why does AltUp work?</h2>; <p>; AltUp increases a model's capacity by adding and <em>;efficiently</em>; leveraging auxiliary parameters to the embedding table, and maintaining the higher dimensional representation across the layers. We believe that a key ingredient in this computation lies in AltUp's prediction mechanism that performs an ensemble of the different blocks. This weighted combination enables continuous message passing to the entire vector despite activating only sub-blocks of it in each layer. Recycled-AltUp, on the other hand, does not add any additional parameters to the token embeddings. However, it still confers the benefit of simulating computation in a higher dimensional representation space since a higher dimensional representation vector is maintained when moving from one transformer layer to another. We conjecture that this aids the training by augmenting the flow of information through the network. An interesting research direction is to explore whether the benefits of Recycled-AltUp can be explained entirely by more favorable training dynamics. </p>; <div style="line-height: 40%;">; <br />; </div>;
